title: Praia Melão
content:
Praia Melão is a seaside village in the north-eastern part of São Tomé Island in São Tomé and Príncipe, part of Mé-Zóchi District. Its population is 2,668 (2012 census).[1] It lies 1 km northeast of Almas, 1 km southeast of Pantufo and 4.5 km southeast of the capital São Tomé.

This São Tomé and Príncipe geographical location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
